node.display_long_description:
A VR survival horror roguelike.

Trapped in a dying spaceship filled with horrors, you must explore, survive, and find your way back to the safety of Earth. Cosmodread features a rich, tense and immersive atmosphere that will make you forget about the world outside the headset.

EXPLORE: 
Search for resources and find a way home. Every run will have you play in a new procedurally generated layout, with random positions for rooms, corridors, items and hazards, and different emergent situations. You’ll never quite know what’s behind the next door.

SURVIVE: 
Use your own hands to interact with the environment. Open doors, drawers and lockers and rummage through their contents. Collect basic resources, and craft weapons and equipment to deal with both enemies and hazards.

FIGHT: 
Crouch behind cover and shoot at enemies with your crossbow, or set a trap for them to walk into. But remember: ammo is scarce!

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
- Fixed height not matching the real world (seated play is still possible from the new "Seated Mode" option in the Options menu)
- Quest 2: Added dynamic shadows. Increased resolution of some environment textures.
- Keys will no longer spawn in high shelves or inside closed lockers, where they were harder to see
- Keys will no longer receive force from explosions in their vicinity
- Locked doors will no longer become inoperable after being opened by the Cosmonaut
- Fixed monster kill count at the end sometimes displaying excessive numbers
- Improved accessibility of the Options menu from the wrist bracelet
- Players will no longer suffocate after they've triggered the escape sequence
- Improved health syringe detection range
- Changed Polypoid death tip text to something more useful
- Fixed geometry gaps in a corridor room
- Selecting the Exit option from the menu when in the Credits scene will now take you back to the Intro menu
- Other minor fixes and adjustments

NOTE: Runs saved with the previous version won't work after the update. Please switch to the "Old Version" branch if you want to keep playing a previous run. (This is only for saved runs, it doesn't affect blueprint or modifier unlock progression).

node.reviewDescription:
See the full video review here: https://youtu.be/md59Agdnh5I

Cosmodread is possibly the best survival horror game you can get for your Quest right now. In this game you’re a cosmonaut trapped aboard a dying spaceship filled with horrors and your mission is to get back to earth. 

The tense, horror atmosphere is amazing, and the gameplay is both engaging and addictive. The visuals are decent, and I love the retro look that the spaceship has which reminds me of a sci fi program from the 60s/70s.

Ammo is scarce so in addition to weapons, grenades and traps, you will need to hide, run and throw things to distract enemies long enough to get by. The game is well balanced, you always feel like the odds are stacked against you as you scavenge items from the ship to stay alive, but it never gets impossibly difficult or unfair. 

Technically you could complete all objectives on the ship in about 2 hours but it’s very unlikely you will do this on your first go. Realistically you are looking at a few attempts. It took me about 4-5 hours to get through one playthrough and even then there’s a ton of replay value here as the environments are procedurally generated so each time you play, the ship layout and monster/item placement changes up. There are also modifiers you can turn on which change the gameplay (e.g. more monsters, no guns).

For me, this is a must have title and for $15 is worth every cent.

website_page_meta.description: Cosmodread is a VR survival horror roguelike about escaping a dying spaceship filled with nightmares. Stranded in a hostile universe, you must explore, survive, and find your way back to the safety of Earth.
website_page_meta.title: Cosmodread · Oculus Quest
